entry.title: Re: MM01 create Material /Material anlegen not correctly...
entry.content:
Hello @QOne1 

Thank you for sharing the screenshot,it was very helpful

You are right, this is a 2508 IAM Information System bug. The app title is rendered with a stray character.(&) Create Material. No functional impact, IDs and navigation work.

Use IAM App ID MM01_TRAN or App ID MM01 to locate it and keep your incident open under component CA-IAM-APP UI with the label issue in the IAM Information System (languages: EN/DE). No action is needed on your part; SAP will correct the label.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regard

Chuma

entry.title: Application Decisions for Sales Activities
entry.content:
Summary

Activity Management plays a vital role within the Customer Experience domain, particularly in the Sales Execution process (Sales > Sales Execution). It enables sales teams to manage key activities such as appointments, phone calls, and emails, which covers essential tasks that support daily operations and help to achieve successful sales outcomes.

As target architecture for this business capability, we currently have SAP Cloud for Customer, SAP Sales Cloud V2 and SAP S/4HANA Sales. This document will provide you with five criteria to decide how to support your business requirements within these three options.

Most of the information in this document is publicly accessible through various SAP channels, including the SAP Help Portal. The goal of this document is to consolidate everything into one centralized place.

Business Requirements

During the work of deciding which functionalities to consider for Activity Management, these are the related business capabilities documented in the Reference Business Architecture (as part of the SAP EAF):

  • Activity and Visit Management: Ability to plan and manage sales activities, such as appointments, phone calls, and e-mails, and to plan, conduct, and track customer visits, including planning and maintaining routes.
  • Activity and Visit Optimization: Ability to maximize efficiency and effectiveness of sales representatives' in-person visits to retail stores. Activity optimization focuses on prioritizing tasks representatives complete during store visits. Visit optimization focuses on planning efficient visit routes and prioritizing which stores reps visit.

Solution Options

Three options are available that could cover the respective capabilities:

  • SAP Cloud for Customer - Sales Cloud: Activities, Visits and Routes
  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2: Activities and Playbooks
  • SAP S/4HANA Sales: Sales Force Support

Characterization of the Solution Options

SAP Cloud for Customer - Sales Cloud

SAP Sales & Service Cloud, a.k.a. SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C), is SAP's on-demand cloud-based Customer Relationship Management. It consists of SAP Cloud for Sales and SAP Cloud for Services.

Activities
Activities are methods of recording information from interactions between business partners during the customer relationship lifecycle. Managing activities properly also gives transparency to other sales team members working on same accounts.

In SAP Cloud for Customer, activities include appointments, e-mails, phone calls, and tasks. More information in the SAP help portal.

Visits
You can use visit planning and execution to help your sales representatives to plan and record site visits and associated activities. Additional information at Visits.

Routes
By using routes, you can plan a group of visits and arrange them in a logical sequence for your sales representatives. You can create one-day routes or routes that span across a period of time. Routes help information can be found here.

Note: While SAP Cloud for Customer (C4C) is no longer being actively offered as part of SAP’s go-forward strategy, it continues to be widely used by many customers and remains a viable option for sales execution in existing landscapes. This recommendation takes into account the current usage patterns, functional coverage, and integration capabilities of C4C. However, for new implementations, SAP Sales Cloud V2 is SAP’s strategic direction and should be considered as the preferred alternative.

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 is considered the next evolution of SAP C4C - Sales. SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 is designed to help sales teams manage their accounts, leads, opportunities, and activities. This version includes new features and improvements to help sales professionals improve their sales performance, streamline their processes, and provide better customer experiences.

Activities
Similar to C4C, in Sales Cloud V2 you can record information from interactions between business partners during the customer relationship lifecycle. Activities include appointments, e-mails, phone calls, and tasks. More info here.

Activity Planning
Use activity planning with activity assignment rules to assign the surveys and tasks to business objects that are associated with specific accounts. If you want additional information please check the SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 documentation.

Playbooks
A playbook is a customizable set of activities and actions proposals tailored to each sales phase or sales cycle. With flexible routing rules, a sales rep can dynamically assign playbooks to the right opportunity based on various account and opportunity attributes. More information in the SAP help portal.

Digital Selling Workspace
Digital Selling Workspace offers sales professionals an efficient way to streamline their daily activities, ensuring that all necessary information is available in one place. The available activities includes:

  • Use Call Lists for outbound sales activities.
  • Manage Calendar events such as appointments.
  • View recent calls in chronological order.
  • Create emails.

More information available at the Digital Selling Workspace help portal.

SAP S/4HANA Sales

SAP S/4HANA Sales is a component of the SAP S/4HANA suite, which is an SAP system designed to streamline and optimize sales processes within an organization. It enables businesses to manage customer accounts, opportunities, sales orders, pricing, billing and fulfillment more efficiently and effectively. 

Sales Force Support: Activity Management and Visit Planning
Activities Management and Visit Planning enables you to administer activities undertaken by the employees of your company. Any data saved in an activity is an important source of information that needs to be accessed by all relevant employees. 

The available type of activities are Appointments, Interaction Logs and Tasks. More information at the SAP Help Portal.

Criteria to determine the most suitable target solution

1. Deployment options

SAP Cloud for Customer - Sales Cloud
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

Both solutions are SaaS, meaning they’re only available to be deployed in the cloud.

SAP S/4HANA Sales

There are two main SAP S/4HANA deployment options: Cloud and On-Premise. In the cloud area we have public cloud (offered as GROW) and private cloud (offered as RISE).

2. Machine Learning and Generative AI functions

SAP Cloud for Customer - Sales Cloud
Business Text Intelligence
Business Text Intelligence leverages natural language processing capabilities to automatically extract valuable insights from textual data, helping sales teams better understand customer communications and sentiment without manual analysis. It also allows you to use Natural Language Understanding (NLU) to get actionable insights such as visits and appointments from text analysis using business text intelligence. 

You are required to train, activate and test your Business Text Intelligence model before using it. Then, you can go to Activities under the object detail view, and check the recommended activities under Recommendations in Tasks. Finally, you'll see the appointment recommendations based on the notes text. Please check the help portal for detail information.

Note: To enable this, you require an SAP Sales Cloud enterprise license or an Intelligent Sales Execution Add-On license.

Dynamic Visit Planning
The Dynamic Visit Planning add-on provides a holistic front office planning solution that supports both schedule-based and ad-hoc planning. You can automate visit planning, generation, and optimization for accounts you visit in a consistent manner through a simple and efficient planning process. This allows you to best utilize the time that the sales representatives spend with these customers. More information here.

Note: A separate license (SAP Sales and Service Core, Visit Pl) is required before you can add Dynamic Visit Planning to a project.

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2
Business Text Intelligence
Similar functionality as C4C (see previous section).

Business Interaction Intelligence
Business Interaction Intelligence provides insights for appointments and visits. This help sales representatives during interactions with customers. We have two main uses cases:

  • For Appointments: Use Business Interaction intelligence to view pre-meeting brief and post-meeting insights of appointments linked to opportunity and lead: Pre-meeting brief gathers relevant information about the upcoming appointment, this helps a sales representatives to be well-prepared and provide a personalized experience to the customer before as well as during the meeting. You can compose meeting minutes using the GenAI based Email Drafter once the post-meeting brief is available in a completed appointment.
  • For Visits: Pre-visit brief gathers relevant information about the upcoming visit, this helps a sales representatives to be well-prepared for the visit. Post Visit Summary tab displays the information about visit updates, summary of completed surveys linked to the visit, notes summary and task summary.

For more information please visit Business Interaction Intelligence help page.

Email Drafter
Use email drafter from Generative AI to draft email replies for opportunities, leads, sales orders, sales quotes, and generate meeting minutes for appointments.  More details in the SAP Help Portal.

SAP S/4HANA Sales
Currently, no ML or Gen AI is offered in SAP S/4HANA Sales.

3. Integration

Below is an overview of the key integrations available across the three options.

SAP Cloud for Customer - Sales Cloud
Event Notifications: With Event Notifications, you can subscribe to changes to business objects in SAP Cloud for Customer. Notifications are available for create, update, and delete at both root and node levels. For detail information please refer to the SAP Help Portal.

OData Services: The SAP Cloud for Customer OData API complies to the OData version 2 specification including access to entities like Appointment, Email, Phone Call, Task and Visit.

OData API v2: For the API v2, the current entities available are: Appointment, Email, Phone Call, Task, Visit, Activity Extension and Social Media Activity.

More detail information about the OData API here.

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2
Rest API: Several APIs are available to integrate including the following services: Activity Plan, Activity Assignment Rule, Interaction Chat, Appointment, Task, In-Person Interaction and Interaction Email. More information at the Business Accelerator Hub.

Autoflow: Autoflow involves creation of rules that can trigger actions such as send event notifications to integrated solutions, in-app notifications to users, and trigger automatic emails for business entities. You can send these events and notifications from an entity (object) in the system and then monitor its execution. For more details please visit Autoflow.

Microsoft Teams Integration: This in an embedded in-app integration of the SAP Sales Cloud V2 with Microsoft Teams. With this integration you can:

  • Create Appointments
  • Make Outbound Calls
  • Message Extension (that allows you to search and share entities directly within Microsoft Teams chats)

Additional information here.

SAP S/4HANA Sales
APIs for Sales: You can use APIs to connect business processes across your system landscape and integrate with external consumers of your services. Two supported protocols:

  • Open Data Protocol (OData)
  • Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP)

The available APIs for the Sales Force Support area are: Appointments, Phone Calls and Tasks. More information here.

4. Integration with SAP S/4HANA

SAP Cloud for Customer - Sales Cloud

Cloud for Customer integration with SAP S/4HANA requires an integration platform to synchronize master data like Prospects and Accounts. Two options are available:

  • SAP Cloud Integration (SAP Integration Suite): It offers out-of-the-box prepackaged integration content (iFlows) for C4C and SAP S/4HANA integration. These iFlows can be customized to match your requirements. For technical details please refer to the setting up guide
  • SAP Process Integration: iFlows package needs to be downloaded and configured in SAP PI. For technical details please refer to the setting up guide

A OData Services API is also available to integrate with external systems.

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 integrates with the SAP S/4HANA system via SAP Cloud Integration and SAP Event Mesh (SAP Business Technology Platform). Please refer to the setting up guide for more technical details.

A set of REST APIs are also available for integrations.

SAP S/4HANA Sales

Since SAP S/4HANA Sales resides within SAP S/4HANA there’s no need for an integration platform or middleware to integrate.

5. Mobile features

SAP Cloud for Customer - Sales Cloud
SAP Cloud for Customer provides you with instant access to the solution data from a phone or tablet using the SAP Cloud for Customer Mobile Apps available for iPad, Android and Windows Tablet. The current features for Sales include Click to Call, all available Activities, Activity Planner, E-Mail Integration and Visits.

The Mobile Apps includes an offline capability to add, modify, or delete items that are saved locally and will be synchronized when you connect to the network.

More information in the SAP Help Portal, About Mobile Options.

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2
The SAP Sales Cloud Mobile application allows you to access your sales productivity on the go providing you access to data in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2, allowing you to:

  • View, create, and manage appointments with your customers.
  • Access activity information on the calendar via day/week and agenda views.

Among other entities you can manage Appointments, Visits and Tasks. For additional information please visit SAP Sales Cloud Mobile Application.

Note: There's no offline support for this application. Only the Downloads option (iOS only) allows you to view (read only) previously synced data for certain entities including Visits and Appointments.

SAP S/4HANA Sales
Not offered.

6. New releases and innovation

SAP Cloud for Customer - Sales Cloud

SAP releases quarterly updates of C4C delivering innovations to users through a combination of new functionalities and improvements, cloud-based architecture, and integration with other SAP solutions. These new releases can’t be evaded, and the date and time are well known. Please check the help portal for detail information.

Note: C4C has scheduled maintenance windows (with a downtime of max. 4 hours) weekly and major upgrade windows (with a downtime of max. 12 hours) quarterly. More information in the link above.

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

Like C4C, SAP Sales Cloud V2 releases quarterly updates. Since SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 is built on a microservices-based cloud architecture, it allows for continuous updates and faster delivery of new features without major disruptions.

SAP S/4HANA Sales

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition has new releases every quarter while SAP S/4HANA private edition has a 2-year release cycle with Feature Pack Stacks every six months.

Evaluation Spreadsheet

Finally, here’s a short overview of the decision criteria we presented in this document.

 SAP C4C Sales CloudSAP Sales Cloud V2SAP S/4HANA Sales
Deployment optionsCloudCloudOn-Prem
Cloud (Public or Private)
ML and Gen AI
MLML + Gen AINot offered.
IntegrationEvents, OData, APIEvents, API, Teams integrationOData, SOAP
Integration with S/4 HANACloud Integration
Process Integration		Cloud IntegrationNA
Mobile AppMobile App availableMobile ApplicationNot offered.
New releases and innovationQuarterlyQuarterly.
Based on microservices.		Public Cloud: Quarterly
Private Cloud:
Feature Pack Stacks every six months

Conclusion

The key decision criteria outlined above reflect five common considerations among our customers to decide which solution could support your activity management in the sales lifecycle:

  • Deployment
  • Machine Learning and Generative AI: Both cloud solutions offer machine learning capabilities, while Sales Cloud V2 is the only option that includes Generative AI features.
  • Integration: All three solutions provide integration channels, though SAP C4C and Sales Cloud V2 incorporate the most up-to-date technologies.
  • Integration with the Backoffice: Both cloud solutions require an integration tool, whereas SAP S/4HANA Sales operates within the same system.
  • Mobile Application: Both SAP C4C and Sales Cloud V2 offer mobile apps with support for Activity Management.
  • Release of New Functionality: While all three solutions receive regular updates, the majority of innovations are introduced within the CX portfolio.

If you are also evaluating Opportunity Management, please refer to the Application Decisions for Opportunity Management guidance.

entry.title: Re: MM01 create Material /Material anlegen not correctly...
entry.content:
Hello @QOne1 

Based on the details you provided the issue is not a configuration issue on your side but a more of a UI label defect introduced in the 2508 release. This implies that the underlying IAM App ID and functionality are correct. The issue is purely text or UI metadata in the app catalog delivered with 2508. This affects display in IAM Information System but does not impact authorizations or functionality of the app itself.

Please note, no action is needed on your side for functionality. Users can still access the app normally via its app ID or tile. Since you have already raised an incident, this type of defect will likely be corrected in the next hotfix collection or 2508 patch. Monitoring SAP’s What’s New Viewer for correction announcements will ensure you get informed when the hotfix is live.

Consult the following links for more details.

IAM Information System

SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508 Release Notes

Summary is the Create Material issue is a known labelling error introduced in 2508. Functionality is unaffected, but SAP needs to correct the metadata. The best path is to track your OSS ticket and watch for the next HFC update where SAP will restore the correct app label.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Material Determination: material A --> material A + B...
entry.content:
I will answer to your questions for each one.

  • Materials B and C are dependent of A for a delimitated period. Out of this period B and C can be sell standalone
  • B and C are always added only in validity dates
  • quantity of B and C are the same of A
  • as said, my customer do not use VA01 to insert sales order, but only RFC function.

Enhance the RFC is the solution in this way:
I will use material determination as database to link A to B and C
I don't link to sales order to material determination procedure
Enanchement RFC funtion to check if exist a material determination by reading KOTDxxx tables. If YES I will add material B and C in sales order items.
What do you think about that?

entry.title: Re: "Could Not Open App" Error in SAP Mobile Start Androi...
entry.content: Hi @ItsMeGopi, This is not a communication or destination error. The issue is due to a missing or misconfigured inbound navigation target which is either a semanticObject or action mapping for the My Inbox app in Work Zone. Please note on desktop, apps can open directly via URL. On mobile, SAP Mobile Start relies on the semantic object plus action pair to resolve and launch the app. If this mapping is missing or incorrect, the app tile appears but cannot be opened. Best regards Chris

entry.title: Re: Facing issues in Handling huge data in sap build apps
entry.content: @Priyanka_Maddiveni the root cause is that the filter formula is applied after pagination, so it only processes the data loaded for the current page. To resolve this, you need to ensure filtering is applied to the entire dataset before pagination

entry.title: Re: Supplier Outgoing Payment Workflow process
entry.content:
In the workflow-based release of payment proposals, the workflow is designed to trigger only once, at the proposal creation stage. The first agent or approver is responsible for reviewing the open items, allocating house banks, account IDs, and payment methods, Releasing or rejecting the proposal. Once this agent completes the task, the workflow does not cascade to additional approvers, unless you have explicitly configured multi-step approval logic, which is not standard in this workflow scenario.

If your requirement is to have multiple sequential approvals, then, try with workflow template WS78500050, where you can add with additional steps with separate agents. On the other hand, if your client needs flexible workflow with multi-level approval, consider switching to payment requests instead of direct F110 proposals. Payment requests support Flexible workflow framework, Approve/Reject buttons in Fiori Inbox and Multi-step approval chains

entry.title: Re: Unable to get the Job packs created when "create work...
entry.content:
Hi there,

I’ve come across a similar issue where triggering "Create Work Packs" from the FIORI App "Find M" didn’t result in Job Packs being generated. In many cases, this problem can stem from backend service misconfigurations or missing authorizations related to the Job search process within the Job search App development environment.

Here are a few things to check:

  1. Backend Job Search Service: Make sure the Job search service is properly connected and active. Sometimes, service binding issues prevent the creation of Job Packs.

  2. User Authorizations: Verify that your user has the correct permissions to create work packs. Missing roles can block this functionality.

  3. App Development Settings: Confirm that the FIORI App’s development configurations, especially around the creation triggers, are correctly set up and aligned with backend processes.

  4. Error Logs: Check system logs and trace files for any error messages when you initiate the “Create Work Packs” action. These logs often provide clues.

If all the above are in place and the issue persists, it might be worth raising an incident with the development or support team to review deeper system integrations.

Hope this helps!

entry.title: Ledger 0E is not a universal journal entry ledger Message No. FINS_ACDOC_CUST107
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

entry.title: Aggregator component in SAP Cloud Integration - Correlation function
entry.content:
The Aggregator component is a very powerful and versatile component, which can be used for many different things. Today we will focus on the Correlation feature.

Working with data file interfaces, it is common that data arrives in a raw and flat format, often containing multiple records that belong logically together. In SAP Cloud Integration (CPI), the Aggregator step helps us collect and group these messages so that they can be processed as a single unit.

In this blog post, we will look at scenario where we receive General Ledger (GL) records that must be paired into Credit and Debit entries, based on a common GL ID. We’ll use the Correlation function of the Aggregator to achieve this grouping. The Aggregator may be overlooked as the first go-to option and we may be thinking about Groovy scripts or XSLT transformation, but Aggregator is the smoothest way to do this.

The Input Data

ur source system delivers data in a flat, delimited structure:

US01|01 01 180000039|US01|0011040120|0011040120||01012025|01012025|01012025|D|USD|100.00|USD|100.00|||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||
US01|01 01 180000039|US01|0011040100|0011040100||01012025|01012025|01012025|C|USD|100.00|USD|100.00|||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||
US01|02 01 180000080|US01|0011040120|0011040120||02012025|02012025|02012025|D|USD|150.00|USD|150.00|||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||
US01|02 01 180000080|US01|0011040100|0011040100||02012025|02012025|02012025|C|USD|150.00|USD|150.00|||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||

These are four GL records, which actually form two logical pairs:

  • Debit & Credit for GL ID 01 01 180000039
  • Debit & Credit for GL ID 02 01 180000080

The field at position 2 is the GL Id and field at position 10 indicates whether it is Debit (D) or Credit (C).

Converting Flat Data to XML

Since the Aggregator works with XML, our first task is to transform the flat file into XML. This is done using CSV to XML Converter component.

Here we have to provide:

  • XSD schema – to define the structure of the incoming message.

  

  • Path to target element - this is the path in xsd where the GL record is actually stored
  • Field separator - a pipe in our case

After the message passes this step, we get one XML with four records like this.
 

Now we have to split this single XML into separate messages using Splitter to be able to use the Aggregator component, as it works with individual XMLs and performs the aggregation / correlation on them. We are splitting again on the /root/item xpath.
You can see the sequence on the screenshot above: Converter -> Splitter -> Aggregator.

Grouping with the Aggregator

Now comes the interesting part: Aggregator with Correlation.
In the Aggregator step, we configure the Correlation Expression to use the GL_Id field.

This ensures that all records sharing the same GL_Id are collected into a single group. Once the group is complete (for example, after receiving both Debit and Credit), the Aggregator releases the combined message.

As a result, instead of four separate records, we get two XML documents grouped on GL_Id value. In the terms of SAP, we got a paired GL posting record with Debit and Credit side.

Mapping to S/4HANA

Of course, SAP S/4HANA expects different field names and a slightly different XML structure for posting GL documents.
Here we typically use an XSLT mapping or a Message Mapping step to transform the aggregator’s output into the required S/4HANA format.
These steps is highly dependent on the target API (e.g. Journal Entry API), but conceptually it’s just restructuring fields.

End-to-End Flow

Summarizing the integration steps:

  1. Receive Flat File (pipe-delimited records).
  2. Convert to XML using XSD + converter.
  3. Split per individual records
  4. Aggregate Records by GL_Id with Correlation.
  5. Transform to S/4HANA Format via XSLT mapping.
  6. Send to S/4HANA using the standard OData/HTTPS adapter.

The Correlation feature of the Aggregator in SAP CPI is very helpful. It allows us to logically group related records—even if they arrive as separate messages—so that downstream systems like S/4HANA receive them as consistent and balanced documents.

entry.title: Re: BOP is not working for MTO scenerio
entry.content:
Now I realized that in MTO (B6), the planned order creates supply in special stock ‘E’, pegged to the sales order. BOP typically works with general ATP stock, not pegged supply. Unless BOP is configured to include special stock ‘E’, it won’t confirm the order, even if supply exists.

Couple of options are there to fix this.

  • Use Confirmation Strategy “Fill” instead of “Win” or “Improve”. “Fill” strategy confirms requirements only if supply is available, without reallocating. It may work better with pegged supply in MTO scenarios.
  • The other option is in Configure BOP Segment, ensure ATP category for special stock ‘E’ is included, Requirement type KE or strategy group B6 is part of the segment. This allows BOP to recognize pegged supply as usable

entry.title: Re: Component assigned to Ref. Operation Set (CA11) is no...
entry.content:
For information, whatever ROS created via CA11 are designed to standardize the operation sequences. But however, BOM components assigned to operations in ROS are not automatically transferred to production or rework orders. The system does not treat ROS as a full routing with integrated BOM, it only copies operations, unless additional configuration is done.

To include the components, create a standard routing, use the ROS as a template, assign BOM components in the routing itself, not in ROS. By this, when creating the rework order via CO07, use this routing. The system will pull both operations and components. If your rework order is based on a material, create a production version that links the routing (with operations from ROS), and the BOM. This ensures that both operations and components are pulled during order creation

entry.title: Re: Capturing Pricing with 4 Decimal Places in Sales Orders
entry.content:
Amount and Prices in SAP carry a number of decimal places per currency code.

  • If you want to keep more decimal per prices than the currency code, you have to adjust the he price factor quantity field (e.g. prices per 100 items in your case)

entry.title: Re: Test case duplicate in the Test Execution - Test plan...
entry.content:
Hi @Fernanda_Lucas,
I'm pretty sure this is the expected behaviour.
CALM is basically giving you the option to either execute the test case as part of the test plan (results will count towards the test plan total) or as a standalone test case ( test plan = none; results will not count towards a test plan).
If you add the test case to an additional test plan it will show up in "Test Execution" an additional time (giving you the option to execute it as part of that additional test plan).

For test execution you could for example

  • (ask your testers to) filter for for the test plan that is to be tested
  • or assign testers to test cases of the plan to be executed and ask the testers to filter for their assignment in test execution. 

BR,

Thomas

entry.title: Re: Production order confirmation excess yield quantity -...
entry.content:
As rightly pointed out, the issue is with your UoM. SAP calculates component consumption based on yield quantity, it tries to backflush for 120 units, but the UoM conversion between grams and pounds causes rounding or conversion errors, leading to COGI (Automatic Goods Movement Error).

Try the below workaround options

  • Set backflush logic to not scale with over-yield in routing or work center. Use control key settings to restrict component consumption to order quantity, not actual yield. This avoids over-consumption when yield exceeds planned quantity.
  • If you foresee overproduction, then, define scrap percentage in BOM or routing. Use overproduction tolerance in order type or material master. This allows SAP to handle extra yield without triggering errors.

Finally, Use COGI to analyze and manually post or correct failed movements. Use CO1P to reprocess confirmation with corrected quantities or UoM

entry.title: Re: Population of field TECHDESC in table USR21
entry.content:
The field BUT000-NAME1 TEXT is from HR employee name. 
-->
The field ADRP-NAME1 TEXT is from field BUT000-NAME1 TEXT.
----->
The field USR21-TECHDESC is from field ADRP-NAME1 TEXT.

If the USR21-TECHDESC field is blank, after initial employee synchronization to BP, then you may use transaction BPU_TECHDESC_CORRECT or report RFS4BPU_UPDATE_USER_TECH_DESC under module CA-GTF-BUM. It will start a report from the user management team which search for wrong TECHDESC (Description) entries at user and fix them from field ADRP-NAME1 TEXT.
If you have further issue about the report, please contact the component CA-GTF-BUM.

entry.title: Re: Can we add custom fields as a new XML tag field in th...
entry.content:
Hello @Gahan_Narayan1 

Thank you for your question to the SAP Community.

Yes, use BAdI EDOC_IT_XML_FILE (Italy: XML File Filling) to place your custom billing fields into the FatturaPA XML. You can not add tags outside the official XSD; use the allowed nodes, typically AltriDatiGestionali, at the header and/or line. SAP Support Portal-3430600 - eDocument Italy - xml attachments  fatturapa.gov.it-B2G and B2B ordinary Invoice

How to implement

Ensure your fields are in the extended I_BillingDocument / I_BillingDocumentItem and published. Next, implement EDOC_IT_XML_FILE in Custom Fields & Logic by copying the standard structure to the modifiable one and injecting your values (header: DatiGeneraliDocumento/AltriDatiGestionali, item: DettaglioLinee/AltriDatiGestionali).

Test via Manage Electronic Documents and ensure the output validates against FatturaPA.

If you need a partner-specific variant outside S/4, transform the file in SAP Integration Suite with XSLT mapping,but the file sent to SdI must still conform to FatturaPA. SAP Help Portal-Create XSLT Mapping

Feel free to reach out if you need further information

Best regards,
Chuma

Useful SAP Documenation References

  • SAP Help: Manage Electronic Documents app (DRC processing). SAP Help Portal-Manage Electronic Documents
  • SAP Help: Document and Reporting Compliance overview. SAP Help Portal-Document and Reporting Compliance
  • SAP Help (Integration Suite): Create XSLT Mapping / mapping capabilities. SAP Help Portal-Create XSLT Mapping-https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/create-xslt-mapping

entry.title: Re: Job Requisition Created Through Position Org Chart does not show association with Position
entry.content: Hello, since my last message, we found the cause of the issue on our system: a candidate had been hired against the original job requisition. They passed through Manage Pending Recruits, and an employee record was created on EC. The job requisition was then closed. Their employee record on EC was reported as a 'No Show'. Later on, the requisition was re-opened, and the association to the position was lost on the position org chart. This was because a candidate was already successfully hired against the original job requisition, although they became a reported No Show. To resolve this, a new job requisition was raised.

entry.title: Clarification on Advanced Formula Logic for Copying LOTSIZE in SAC IFP Product Costing
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I’m working on a Data Action within SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Integrated Financial Planning (IFP) for Product Costing, specifically focused on copying the Product Cost Estimate LOTSIZE.

I’ve come across two different implementations of the formula logic and would appreciate your insights on the differences between them.

Standard code :

// Copy Lotzsize
DATA([d/Measures] = "LOTSIZE", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_COMPONENTPLANT] = "#", [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_MATERIAL] = "#",
	 [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CCACTIVITYTYPE] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_FIXVARIABLE] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_COMPQUANTITY_UNIT] = "#") 
= RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "LOTSIZE", [d/Version] = "public.CostEstimate", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = "#" , [d/SAP_FI_IFP_COMPONENTPLANT] = "#", 
			 [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_MATERIAL] = "#", [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CCACTIVITYTYPE] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_FIXVARIABLE] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_COMPQUANTITY_UNIT] = "#")

 Custom code : 

// Copy Lotzsize
DATA([d/Measures] = "LOTSIZE") 
= RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "LOTSIZE", [d/Version] = "public.CostEstimate", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate])

 

In my custom version, I’ve intentionally excluded the free dimensions (e.g., GLACCOUNT, COMPONENTPLANT, MATERIAL, COSTCENTER, etc.) under the assumption that:

  • These dimensions are not relevant for aggregation or duplication in this context.

  • When excluded in both data and resultlookup, they default to "#"(currently these  dimensions don't have any value) during execution, which aligns with the standard behavior.

Could someone please confirm if this understanding is correct? Are there any potential risks or edge cases I should be aware of when omitting these dimensions in the DATA() and RESULTLOOKUP() statements?

Thanks in advance for your support and guidance!

cc : @hartmut_koerner

Integration Modernization goes SAP TechEd

SAP TechEd 2025 will take place from November 4–6 in Berlin and online, offering developers and IT professionals deep insights into SAP AI, the Business Data Cloud, and the Integration Suite through hands-on labs, expert sessions, and networking opportunities.

Integration Modernization will be part of the SAP TechEd event.

Several Deep Dive Sessions and Hands-On Workshops are planned in collaboration with Product Management and an international team. In addition, our experts will be available at two information booths for direct exchange and networking.

Information booths (all day):

  • Move to the cloud with SAP Integration Suite - (Accelerate your digital transformation by moving to the cloud with SAP Integration Suite and PI Migration Assessment)
  • Integrated, innovate, and modernize with SAP Integration Suite - (Get a general overview and explore use cases, demos, and best practices for SAP Integration Suite)

Deep Dive Session (approx. 45 min):

  • Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite - (Start with a deep dive into migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite by exploring tools, Edge Integration Cell, best practices, and key challenges to ensure a smooth cloud transition.)
  • Run integration scenarios in private landscapes with Edge Integration Cell - (Edge Integration Cell—SAP Integration Suite’s next-generation hybrid runtime that lets you manage APIs and run integrations securely in your private cloud or on-premise landscape.)

Hands-On Workshops (approx. 120 min.) :

  • Central monitoring of integration scenarios with the SAP Cloud ALM solution - (Gain full visibility into your integration landscape with centralized monitoring powered by SAP Cloud ALM)
  • Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite - (Ensure reliable message sequencing by implementing exactly-once in-order delivery with SAP Integration Suite)
  • Modernize and transform your integration to the cloud - (Explore the SAP Integration Suite’s Migration Assessment and Cloud Integration tooling hands-on, including its newly introduced pipeline feature, which enhances integration efficiency and scalability.
  • Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh - (Gain hands-on experience with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, starting with queues and topics, then explore filtering and event replay to build dynamic, event-driven scenarios.)

Join the experience: Onsite — or can't make it to Berlin? Go Virtual !

SAP Integration Suite is redefining enterprise integration by breaking down silos and connecting diverse systems across the business. Whether you're managing an SAP-centric landscape or a hybrid IT environment, its 360-degree Suite approach offers a comprehensive toolset for end-to-end integration and drives business innovation.

We’d love to hear your thoughts and experiences with SAP Integration Suite. What challenges are you facing? How can we help you unlock the full potential of your IT ecosystem? Feel free to connect on TechEd or reach out to us via SAP Integration Services.

#Modernize #Integrate #Innovate – SAP Integration Modernization TEAM

entry.title: Re: Mobile Solution – SAP FSM vs SAP Asset Manager (Utili...
entry.content:
Your question is a very relevant one, especially in utilities where both asset-centric and service-centric processes are critical.

Both SAP Field Service Management, Mobile and SAP Service and Asset Manager are valid options, and the right fit depends on whether your processes are more service-centric or asset-centric.

1. Strengths & Limitations

  • Field Service Mobile: best when the focus is on managing people and resources—optimizing schedules and routes, providing technicians with documentation, and capturing data in the field. Delivered as an out-of-the-box cloud solution, it offers no-code configuration and extension options with Web Containers.

  • Service and Asset Manager: best when the focus is on managing the asset itself, supporting inspections, work orders, and ensuring optimal uptime. Built on the SAP Mobile Development Kit framework, it allows deep customization of screens and processes.

In utilities, we often see Service and Asset Manager used for maintenance crews working on network or plant assets, and Field Service Mobile for customer-facing service teams (installations, metering, service calls). That said, some utilities also use Field Service Mobile for asset maintenance, particularly when the priority is resource efficiency and customer-level service quality.

2. Integration

  • Field Service Mobile is part of SAP Field Service Management (FSM) itself, built on the FSM Cloud, and works seamlessly with its planning and dispatching capabilities.

  • Service and Asset Manager integrates directly with SAP S/4HANA Asset Management and Service. A hybrid approach is possible where FSM handles dispatch and either app is used for execution.

3. Scalability & Maintainability
Both apps are actively supported, cloud-ready, and scale well. Importantly, customers don’t have to choose upfront—the license covers both apps, so you can deploy whichever best fits each user group.

4. Utilities Best Practices

  • SAP Service and Asset Manager is often used for maintenance crews on grid/plant assets. Especi

  • SAP Field Service Management Mobile is often used for customer-facing service teams—but also for asset maintenance when the priority is workforce efficiency and service quality.

entry.title: Re: How to Deploy/Publish RAP & Annotation based UI List...
entry.content:
Hello @G_Sachin,

Thank you for your question,

Below is the verified Public Cloud pathway with clickable links:

What you should do

Expose your data as a UI service
In ADT: CDS → Service Definition → Service Binding (OData V4 – UI) and activate. SAP Help Portal-Defining and Publishing a UI Service

Generate the Fiori Elements app and deploy it
Use SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) → Fiori: List Report/Object Page→ point to your OData V4 service binding URL → Deploy to ABAP your S/4HANA Cloud system. This also creates the FLP app descriptor. SAP-Create a SAP Fiori App and Deploy it to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, ABAP Environment
(VS Code isn’t the supported path for S/4HANA Cloud customers; BAS is the documented route.)

Make it visible to users

Create an IAM App and Business Catalogue -Creating Business Catalogues or add the app to an existing catalogue. SAP Help Portal-Creating an IAM App and Adding It to a Business Catalogue

Alternatively, use Custom Catalogue Extensions to place the app in a catalogue without creating a new one. SAP Help Portal-Custom Catalogue Extensions

In Manage Launchpad Spaces/Pages, add the app as a tile for the role; then assign the role to users. SAP Help Portal-Managing Launchpad Spaces and Pages

Reasons why your Eclipse Preview might not show up as a tile.
The ADT preview is currently in developer preview. A tile appears after deployment and once catalogue or space assignment is completed.

Useful SAP Documentation References

ABAP RAP: Defining and publishing a UI service (Service Binding). SAP Help Portal-Defining and Publishing a UI Service

Tutorial: Create a Fiori application using BAS and deploy it to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, ABAP environment. (Includes steps for IAM app and catalogue). SAP-Create a SAP Fiori App and Deploy it to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, ABAP Environment

Manage Launchpad Spaces/Pages – add an app tile for a specific role. SAP Help Portal

Feel free to reachout.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Trouble Shooting for CDS Views
entry.content:
in the following expression that is used like shown in a productive environment, ep.netwr (ep is alias for ekpo) should be devided by rbkp-kursf to have the value returned in the appropriate currency 

      case

        when curr_to_decfloat_amount(r.Wrbtr) > 0 then r.Wrbtr

                                                  else ep.netwr

      end as Wrbtr,  

 

 

to make things easier I build a separate small view only to do this:

define view entity ZRPR_C_GET_EKPO_NETWR_WITH_REF as select from ekpo as ep

  inner join ekko as e on ep.ebeln = e.ebeln

  inner join rseg as r on  ep.ebeln = r.ebeln

                       and ep.ebelp = r.ebelp

  inner join rbkp as rb on ep.ebeln = r.ebeln

{

  key ep.ebeln,

  key ep.ebelp,

  e.waers as ekko_waers,

  rb.kursf,

  @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'ekko_waers'

  ep.netwr / rb.kursf as netwr

}

NETWR is a field in table EKPO and the reference field für the CURR field is a field in Table EKKO, for this reason the annotation refers to ekko_waers

coded like above the error occurs "Datatype CURR is not supported here", that means I have to use either get_numeric_value( ep.netwr )

or curr_to_decfloat_amount( ep.netwr )  In both cases the annotation is ignored  and trying to activate generates the error in SM21 in SAP: invalid column name EP-WAERS while following the annotation the system should not look for the reference field in table EKPO, because the annotation directs to look for in in table EKKO. Why is the annotation ignored one using curr_to_decfloat_amount or get_numeric_value? What to do, to solve this?

entry.title: Re: How to batch print journal entries in Manage Journal...
entry.content:
Hello @jason_su 

The S4HANA Public Cloud, Manage Journal Entries (F0717A) does not support mass print; Creating correspondence in that app is restricted to a single document (hence the button is disabled when multiple items are selected). To print several vouchers, use the Create Correspondence (F0744A). Open the app, upload the documents, and the output will be managed for each item or list you keep in that app. Note that Print Correspondence (F2801) is FI-CA, not FI-GL, so it won’t be useful for journal vouchers.  

SAP Help Portal-Create Correspondence

If true batch output is required, the workaround is a small custom app or process that loops through the document numbers and triggers correspondence one by one.

With kind regards
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Change payee name for 1 vendor
entry.content:
Please note if the Payee field (LFA1-ZAHLS) is filled, SAP will use that name instead of Name 1. So check in vendor master, how it is filled. Next go to FBZP, and check whether the payee name is pulled from vendor master or overridden. Some configurations allow for alternate payee logic.

For information, from vendor master → Payment Transactions, check:

  • Alternate Payee in Document (LFA1-ZAHLS)
  • Alternate Payee in Master Record (LFB1-ZAHLS)

If these are filled, SAP will use the alternate payee name instead of the vendor’s Name 1.

Also, since your issue is on the output, check the SmartForm which may pull name from Vendor master, Payment document or Alternate payee. Confirm which field is used in the layout logic

entry.title: COPC - Template Allocations for Planned Orders
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
In the industrial planning process, in Controlling, we want to obtain product cost estimates. To obtain the cost estimate, we need to calculate the rates for the activities involved in the process.
Using LTP (Long Term Planning), we can obtain the activity volumes required for the direct activities included in the routing. But we also need to obtain the activity volumes for indirect activities. In our case, indirect activities are allocated using template allocations. Is there a way to use template allocations with planned orders? If so, how? What is the environment in transaction CPT2? And through which transaction is it executed?
Thank you.
